words.definition: If something is antique, it is very old and valuable.
words.example: She collects antique furniture.

words.definition: An applicant is someone who applies for a job or position.
words.example: There were over fifty applicants for the job.

words.definition: An artifact is an old object made by humans that is historical.
words.example: The museum has a collection of ancient artifacts.

words.definition: When something is authentic, it is real and not a copy.
words.example: The restaurant serves authentic Italian food.

words.definition: Chronology is the order in which events happened.
words.example: The historian studied the chronology of the war.

words.definition: A diplomat is a person who represents their country.
words.example: The diplomat worked to improve relations between the countries.

words.definition: An epic is a long poem or story about legendary heroes.
words.example: The Iliad is a famous epic poem.

words.definition: An excerpt is a short piece of writing taken from a larger work.
words.example: I read an excerpt from the novel in the magazine.

words.definition: A fossil is the remains of a plant or animal from long ago.
words.example: The scientist found a dinosaur fossil in the desert.

words.definition: To humiliate someone means to make them feel ashamed.
words.example: He didn't want to humiliate her in front of her friends.

words.definition: A lyric is the words of a song.
words.example: I can't remember the lyrics to that song.

words.definition: Majesty is the quality of being impressive or grand.
words.example: The mountain range was a sight of great majesty.

words.definition: A monarch is a king or queen.
words.example: The monarch ruled the country for many years.

words.definition: To precede something means to happen before it.
words.example: The lightning preceded the thunder.

words.definition: If someone is punctual, they are on time.
words.example: It is important to be punctual for a job interview.

words.definition: To recruit someone means to select them for a job or task.
words.example: The army is looking to recruit new soldiers.

words.definition: A refund is money that is given back to you.
words.example: I asked for a refund when the product didn't work.

words.definition: To register means to put your name on an official list.
words.example: You need to register for the class before it starts.

words.definition: Renown is the state of being famous.
words.example: The artist achieved great renown for his paintings.

words.definition: A tusk is a long pointed tooth of an animal like an elephant.
words.example: Elephants use their tusks to dig for food.
